article.headline: Buffalo 92, Indiana State 64
article.story: BUFFALO, N.Y. (AP) -- Yassin Idbihi had 22 points and Daniel Gilbert chipped in 15 points to help lead Buffalo to a convincing 92-64 win over Indiana State on Saturday. Turner Battle added 14 points and five assists, and Mario Jordan contributed 12 points and five assists for the Bulls, who won for the second straight time. Buffalo (2-1) shot 58 percent from the field in building a 25-point first-half lead, and pushed their advantage to 66-33 seven minutes into the second-half following Mark Bortz's free-throw. Overall, Buffalo shot 57 percent from the floor, and limited Indiana State to just 35 percent shooting. Buffalo was also helped by 16 steals, including four by Jordan and three each by Battle, Calvin Cage, and Roderick Middleton. Indiana State (1-2) was led by David Moss, who had 16 points and 12 rebounds. Eric Gray added 16 points for the Sycamores, who lost their second straight game.
